trans-unit.source: Provides access to general information about a tablet pen.
Adds a handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.GotStylusCapture> attached event.

The event handler to add.
Captures the stylus to the specified element.
Use the Capture method to ensure that `element` receives stylus events even when the cursor goes out of the elements' bounds.

To release the stylus, call <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.Capture%28System.Windows.IInputElement%2CSystem.Windows.Input.CaptureMode%29> with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode> set to <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode>.
The Capture method returns `false` if `element` is not visible or enabled.
The element to capture the stylus to.
if the stylus is captured to element; otherwise, .
Captures the stylus to the specified element.
Use the Capture method to ensure that `element` receives stylus events even when the cursor goes out of the elements' bounds.
To release the stylus, call Capture with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode> set to <xref:System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode>.
The Capture method returns `false` if `element` is not visible or enabled.
The element to capture the stylus to.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode"></xref> values.
if the stylus is captured to element; otherwise, .
Gets the element to which the stylus is bound.
The <xref href="System.Windows.IInputElement"></xref> to which the stylus is bound.
Gets the stylus that represents the stylus currently in use.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice"></xref> that represents the stylus currently in use.
Gets the element that is directly beneath the stylus.
The <xref href="System.Windows.IInputElement"></xref> that is directly beneath the stylus.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsFlicksEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a flick, one of the possible system gestures, is a short, quick, straight stroke that can be mapped to a navigation or shortcut command.
By default, flicks are disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar>.
Flicks are enabled on all other controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether flicks are enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified element has flicks enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether press and hold is enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified element has press and hold enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>;
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTapFeedbackEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a short animation occurs when the user taps the control.
By default, tap feedback is disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
It is enabled on all other controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether tap feedback enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified element has tap feedback enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTouchFeedbackEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
A <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to determine whether touch input feedback enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if touch input feedback is enabled, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsFlicksEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a flick, one of the possible system gestures, is a short, quick, straight stroke that can be mapped to a navigation or shortcut command.
By default, flicks are disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar>.
Flicks are enabled on all other controls.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable flicks.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to enable flicks; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to disable flicks.
Sets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
Press and hold maps to the right-click on a mouse.
In Windows Vista, you can disable this behavior on elements if you foresee a situation where the user might hold the tablet pen down without intending to simulate a right-click.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable press and hold.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to enable press and hold; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to disable press and hold.
Sets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTapFeedbackEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
In Windows Vista, a short animation occurs when the user taps the control.
By default, tap feedback is disabled on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
It is enabled on all other controls.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable tap feedback.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to enable tap feedback; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to disable tap feedback.
Sets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTouchFeedbackEnabled*> attached property on the specified element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> on which to enable tap feedback.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to enable touch input feedback; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to disable touch input feedback.

To be added.
Synchronizes the cursor and the user interface.
Applications may need to determine the element on which the cursor is located.
If the application uses animation, the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.DirectlyOver%2A> method might return an element that has moved out from under the cursor.
Call Synchronize to be sure that <xref:System.Windows.Input.Stylus.DirectlyOver%2A> returns the proper element.
